# jabr

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of jabr is to browse, list, and fetch dataset from Open Data Jawa Barat right from R.

## Installation

You can install the released version of jabr from [GitHub](https://github.com/aswansyahputra/jabr) with:

``` r
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("aswansyahputra/jabr")
```
## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

```{r example}
library(jabr)

(x <- jabr_list_dataset())

pdrb_adhk <- 
  x %>% 
  dplyr::slice(1:5) %>% 
  jabr_fetch()

pdrb_adhk

# You can then run `tidyr::unnest()` to expand the dataset and perform some cleaning steps
pdrb_adhk %>% 
  tidyr::unnest(cols = c(dataset)) %>% 
  tidyr::extract(title, "tahun", "(\\d{4})", convert = TRUE)
```
